metadata.title: USN-3048-1 -- curl vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Bru Rom discovered that curl incorrectly handled client certificates when resuming a TLS session. (CVE-2016-5419)  It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled client certificates when reusing TLS connections. (CVE-2016-5420)  Marcelo Echeverria and Fernando Mu√±oz discovered that curl incorrectly reused a connection struct, contrary to expectations. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-5421)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3048-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libcurl4-gnutls-dev - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-openssl-dev - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-doc - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-nss-dev - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
